pullRequest.title: Issue 5395: SLTS - Allow parallel/non-sequential read operations.
pullRequest.bodyText:
Signed-off-by: Sachin Joshi sachin.joshi@emc.com
Change log description
Allow parallel/non-sequential read operations with SLTS.
Purpose of the change
Fixes #5395
What the code does
Following operations should are not serialized, but allowed to execute independent of any other pending requests.

openRead
read
exists
getStreamSegmentInfo

Note - When openRead is called for the first time for a given segment after fail over it is possible that there is a need to reconcile length of the last chunk. In this case the sub-operation to reconcile is run sequentially. Otherwise all openRead can be concurrent.
How to verify it
Tests should pass.
System tests should pass.

Why so you need to start the computation this way?
Why not just submitting the operation to the thread pool?
The weird fact is that the operation returns a CompletableFuture so we may expect it to be already an asynchronous operation (but probably this is not always the case?)
